sentence.Network_en: I really feel aggrieved at this sort of thing.
sentence.Network_cn: 我真为这种事感到委屈。

sentence.Network_en: His tone was by turns angry and aggrieved.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的语气时而透着愤怒，时而流露出哀怨。

sentence.Network_en: He felt aggrieved at not being chosen for the team.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因没被选到队里感到愤愤不平.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'distressed'): past participle of aggrieve, from Old French agrever 'make heavier', based on Latin aggravare (see aggravate)

entry.def: If you feel aggrieved, you feel upset and angry because of the way in which you have been treated.

example.ex: I really feel aggrieved at this sort of thing.
example.tran: 我真为这种事感到委屈。
